basic.description: This course covers classical and modern principles and practice of software engineering, including classical and object-oriented approaches to architecture, design, life cycle, and project management; software metrics; change management; teams and teaming tools; reusability, portability, and interoperability; requirements and specification.
basic.subject: CEN
basic.title: Software Engineering Principles and Practice

extra.enrollment_requirement: Pre- or corequisite: COP 4530, as well as experience creating or changing a large software system and putting principles of software engineering to practice.
